docs.title: Welcome to AIGVE: the AI Generated Video Evaluation toolkit!
For contributing
docs.text: Contributing to the project, including report/fix bugs, add new features, improve documentation, and send feedbacks, can all be done via the project github issue page at https://github.com/ShaneXiangH/VQA_Toolkit/issues.

docs.title: For Licenses
docs.text: AIGVE is an open-source project. For more information about the licenses, please refer to the license page.

docs.title: AIGVE Documentation
docs.text:
The documentations of the AIGVE library will be organized as follows.

docs.title: Get Started with AIGVE
docs.text:
• About us

    Get more information about AIGVE and use it in your function learning projects.

    More Information

  • Installation

    Install AIGVE with pip and set up the dependency in just minutes.

    How to Install

  • Quickstart

    A quickstart tutorial to help you use AIGVE APIs for AIGVE model training.

    Get Started

docs.title: About us
docs.text: AIGVE is a website hosting the documentations, tutorials, examples and the latest updates about the AIGVE library.

docs.title: What is AIGVE?
docs.text:
AIGVE is a Python library developed by the IFM Lab for AI Generated Video Evaluation.

  • Official Website: https://shanexiangh.github.io/VQA_Toolkit/
  • Github Repository: https://github.com/ShaneXiangH/VQA_Toolkit
  • IFM Lab https://www.ifmlab.org/

docs.title: Citing Us
docs.text: If you find AIGVE library and ... papers useful in your work, please cite the papers as follows:
